conbody.p: To use Kerberos authentication, the NCCNS Kafka client needs the Kerberos configuration file krb5.conf and keytab(s) that contain pairs of Kerberos principals and encrypted keys. To make these files available inside the SPSNS containers, copy them to all the comsvc nodes at the path /opt/tpa/conf/sac/external/.
An automated script copies the krb5.conf file from the /opt/tpa/conf/sac/external/ directory to the /etc/krb5.conf directory of the SPSNS container.

section.codeblock:
#---------------------------------------------------------------
#Configuration snippets may be placed in this directory as well includedir /etc/krb5.conf.d/
[logging] default = FILE:/var/log/krb5libs.log kdc = FILE:/var/log/krb5kdc.log admin_server = FILE:/var/log/kadmind.log
[libdefaults] dns_lookup_realm = false ticket_lifetime = 24h renew_lifetime = 7d forwardable = true rdns = false pkinit_anchors = /etc/pki/tls/certs/ca-bundle.crt default_realm = MYREALM default_ccache_name = KEYRING:persistent:%{uid}
[realms] MYREALM =
{ kdc = hisingh admin_server = hisingh } [domain_realm] .hisingh = MYREALM hisingh = MYREALM #---------------------------------------------------------------
